name: Camino Real Aeropuerto

reviews.text: This hotel is very convenient for a night between flights, but did not strike us as extraordinary.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: We arrived very tired with our daughter but were not offered any help with the luggage. As a sideline, luggage trolleys have to be left in the luggage area of the airport, but there are porters to take you to the hotel. On the way back, we had to tip a hotel porter to take the luggage across the bridge to the airport, then another one to take us to check-in. Still, the location is very convenient.
reviews.title: A Bit Dated

reviews.text: The hotel room was very clean and modern. I was just a bit puzzled to find an ironing board, television etc but no hair dryer.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel -- just get some staff who understand hospitality

reviews.text: So to summarise, the hotel is very convenient and the rooms are clean and fine, but it's as impersonal as any big hotel and does not leave a lasting impression.
reviews.title: Review Oct 8-15

likes.disliked: — there's nothing musch to see or do nearby. it's a little far from downtown. the hotel taxi is very expansive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only benefit of this hotel was the location, just a pedestrian bridge away from the airport. A great thing when you are flying over 20 hours from India to get there.
reviews.title: great place to stay
One of the best hotels
reviews.text: Camino Real Airport Hotel at Mexico City is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It is clean, modern, safe, beautiful, convenient (you can walk to the airport), and very chic. Still the prices are reasonable. There is late check in and check out. My only problem was with the breakfast. We were told that breakfast was included in the price and we could eat until noon. When we went to the hotel restaurant at 11:30 am, we were seated and brought menus. When my girlfriend asked why we needed the menus when the buffet would be included, the manager said we had to go to the restaurant at the top floor and not the one we were at (they could have said that when we entered the restaurant telling them we were there for our free breakfast--instead they tried to see if they could trick us into paying--but then again in Mexico in general everyone tries to see how much money they can get out of you). When we went to the restaurant at the top floor, they said breakfast was over at 11 am. This kind of miscommunication (having been told breakfast is available till noon when it is only available till 11 am) was unacceptable for a hotel such as Camino Real. Other than that glitch, we were happy. I would recommend this hotel.

RECOMMENDED. Hotel is directly connected to airport. I used this for 1 night as had very early morning departure. Booked via Expedia, no problems. Hotel appears to have renovations under way. My room in the 2nd wing, was very small, 2 beds, relatively dimly illuminated. Bedding was just OK. Some street noise. Bathroom small as well, but well illuminated and in good order. If you come in late, or leave early - this facility is likely to be fine. It's the only 1 directly connected via a covered walkway, so convenience rules.
reviews.title: If you must, it's convenient

reviews.text: This was the perfect place to stay if you're flying out early in the morning. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with all the mod cons, and best of all the airport is only a 30 second walk across a footbridge. The rooms are also very well insulated, so you don't really hear the airport noise. The only disappointment was the night we stayed the room service wasn't available due to a problem with the gas in the kitchen. There are plenty of fast food outlets and a couple of restaurants at the airport though, it was just unfortunate that we wanted room service that night in particular. There was a bit of a queue at check-out at 5am when we had to get our flight, so take that into account, that everyone is likely to be rushing for flights when you leave and give yourselves and extra 15 mins or so.
reviews.title: All you need in a airport hotel

reviews.text: The Camino Real group has done a good job remodeling this hotel. Its location can not be beat. You can walk across a bridge to the airport, and given Mexico City's unpredictable traffic, that can be a great comfort. Lobby bar and restaurants are above average for your typical airport hotel. Best value of the airport hotels in Mexico City.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this property prior to taking an early morning flight back to the US. It was a pleasant surprise. The interior is modern, warm, and very comfortable. I wouldnt recommend this hotel if your desire to do any sightseeing, but for those needing a hotel very close to the airport (it is actually attached to the terminal), you cant go wrong.
reviews.title: get place to relax before an early morning flight
Check-in is Abominable
reviews.text: Arrived at 7pm. Waited on line for 15 minutes while about 10 people in front of me for check-in. Decided to have dinner in the hotel restaurant with colleagues. When I came back after dinner the line was over 60 long. Took over 1 hour to get through the line for a simple process. (When I got to the front of the line, I counted 65 people behind me.)

reviews.title: Decent for a convenience stay
reviews.text: Hotel needs to install several more check-in CRTs, say 5-10, and man them for when the 4 or more European 747s that arrive all at the same time!! This is a simple disregard of customers based on their captive market.

reviews.title: OK at weekend rates, otherwise aripoff
reviews.text: The restaurants were adequate, but nothing special. I've eaten more inspired Mexican food at locat taco stands than the fancy plates served at dinner. Again, captive customer can't find a cheaper better meal.

reviews.title: Good Location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Camino Real on the last day of our trip to Mexico City. The hotel is very convenient if you have an early morning flight. You can walk from the hotel across a bridge to the terminal. The hotel staff was very pleasant. The rooms were ok, nothing great. Do not expect luxury by any means. The hotel was very clean. We paid $214 after taxes for our room with 2 beds. It was expensive, but very convenient. We did think about staying at the Hilton located inside the international terminal but after hearing all the reviews about how bad the smell is there, we decided on the Camino. We were happy with our stay. Had our flight not been so early in the morning, we would have stayed at the Four Seasons.

reviews.title: Pleasant Stay
reviews.text: I missed my flight so I had to stay in a hotel. Even though I am familiar with Mexico City I felt overwhelmed in finding a safe hotel. The desk clerk at the airline I was traveling was nice enough to suggest Camino Real and made the reservation for me. At the entrance my bags were checked in and taken over by the bellman. After that my pleasant experience started. I had room service for dinner and breakfast which was delicious. All the employees were very courteous and efficient. My checkout was done in a very timely matter. My bags were taken all the way to the exit were the bellman hailed a baggage boy to take them all the way to the airline which I was going to fly out on the other side of airport. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I would recommend to anyone. The view of the room was awesome. My window faced the domestic landing runway of the airport. Even with this it was quiet and I slept peacefully. The room was extremely clean.

reviews.title: Nice 3 star hotel - Can walk to the gate st the airport.
reviews.text: While it's not a lavish hotel, my room was clean, the staff very curtious, and the restaurants above standard. Unless you want to shop at the airport there isn't much to do as they definitely are catering to the business traveller. I didn't use the Business Center myself but did walk through & it seemed to have everything necessary. This hotel is best for overnight stays when catching an early flight or as a central point if you want to explore Mexico City on your own.

reviews.title: Decent, but not spectacular
reviews.text: My husband and I were fortunate enough to take a 10 day trip to Mexico at the beginning of November. We stayed with a friend in Cuernavaca for 7 nights and at the Camino Real Aeropuerto in Mexico City for the last two nights.

The hotel's location was convenient and the price was good... but the room was small and the bathroom could have been cleaned better. There were a couple of bolts sticking up out of the carpet on the bedroom floor that we both stubbed our toe or jammed our heel on in the middle of the night. It is located right next to the airport, but they did a fine job of sound insulation because we didn't hear a single plane the entire time. We did however hear the water squeeling throught the pipes at 6 a.m. when our neighbor took their shower both mornings.
reviews.title: Not Much To Recommend

aka: Camino Real Aeropuerto Hotel Mexico City
